text:
<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1/2 cup. barbecue sauce
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Place in baking dish, pour barbecue sauce over.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour, basting occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **POWDERED SUGAR COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter or margarine
- 1/2 cup powdered sugar
- 21/4 cups flour
- Dash of salt
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- ¾ cup chopped nut meats
<|steps|>
Cream butter and powdered sugar.
Add flour, salt, vanilla, and nuts; mix well.
Using a teaspoon, place small amounts (about the size of a marble) on a cookie sheet.
Bake at 400°F for 14-17 minutes.
Cool, then roll in powdered sugar.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. boiled shrimp
- 6 green onions, finely cut
- 2 blades celery, finely cut
- 2 kernels garlic, finely cut
- 1/2 bell pepper, finely cut
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. parsley
- 1/4 head lettuce, chopped
- 2 Tbsp. mayonnaise
- 1 Tbsp. vinegar
- Salt and pepper to taste
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients.
Mix well, season with salt and pepper.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP DIP**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 3 ounce packages cream cheese
- 1/2 cup salad dressing
- 3 tablespoons chili sauce
- 2 teaspoons lemon juice
- 1/2 teaspoon onion juice
- 4 teaspoon worchestershire sauce
- 1 pound cooked shrimp or (1 - 15 ounce can), well chopped
<|steps|>
Blend cheese with seasoning.
Add well chopped shrimp.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tablespoon unflavored gelatin
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 (8 oz) package Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1/2 cup cream, whipped
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
- 1/2 cup maraschino cherries, chopped
- 1 small can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1 small can fruit cocktail, drained
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in lemon juice, then set in a pan of boiling water to dissolve.
Combine cream cheese, mayonnaise, salt, and sugar; add dissolved gelatin.
Fold in whipped cream, nuts, cherries, pineapple, and fruit cocktail.
Pour into a tray and refrigerate until firm, several hours or overnight.
Slice and serve on a lettuce leaf with a dab of mayonnaise and a cherry on top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BERMUDA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 small cauliflower
- 0.5 large Bermuda onion
- 0.5 cup stuffed olives
- 0.67 cup French dressing
- 1 head lettuce
- 2 cups Roquefort or Blue cheese
<|steps|>
Separate cauliflower into flowerets and slice thin crosswise.
Slice Bermuda onion and separate into rings.
Slice stuffed olives and place all in a bowl with French dressing.
Marinate for 30 minutes.
Break up lettuce and crumble cheese.
Toss all together lightly just before serving.
Serve from the bowl and pass extra French dressing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **S.J.'S SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2 can tomatoes, pulpy
- 1 box lemon jello
- 2 tablespoons vinegar
- Dash of salt
- 1 teaspoon celery seed
- 1/2 cup diced celery
<|steps|>
Break tomatoes into a pulp, add vinegar, salt, and celery seed; cook to boiling point.
Pour hot tomato mixture over jello to dissolve.
Cool, then add diced celery.
Pour into individual molds and chill until congealed.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. MORGAN'S MAYONNAISE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 egg
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1 pint Wesson oil
<|steps|>
Break egg into a mixing bowl, add salt and lemon juice, and beat well.
Slowly add Wesson oil, beating continuously until thick.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 3 cups flour
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 cup blackberry jam (preserves)
- 1 teaspoon soda
- Eggs (implied by steps)
<|steps|>
Cream butter.
Add sugar gradually.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each.
Sift dry ingredients and add alternately with buttermilk and jam.
Bake in 3 nine inch layers at 350°.
**Filling Ingredients:**
- 1 cup crushed pineapple
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1 tablespoon butter
**Filling Steps:**
Mix all ingredients and cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
When cool spread between layers and on top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LUNCHEON SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 oz. cream cheese
- 1/2 cup. sour cream
- Dash of salt
- 3/4 cup. diced celery
- 1/2 cup. chopped walnuts
- 2 Tbsp. chopped green pepper
- 1 1/2 cup. diced chicken
- 1 (13 1/2 oz.) can well-drained pineapple tidbits
- Cranberry cubes, for topping
<|steps|>
Mix cream cheese, sour cream, and salt, then stir in celery, walnuts, and green pepper.
Fold in chicken and pineapple.
Chill thoroughly.
Top with cranberry cubes before serving. Serves 5-6.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MOUSSES PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 tbsp cornstarch
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup sorghum molasses
- 2 tbsp vinegar
- 2 tbsp butter
- 0.125 tsp salt
- 1 cup pecans, optional
- Unbaked pastry, for pie pan
<|steps|>
Mix cornstarch with sugar, then add beaten eggs, molasses, vinegar, melted butter, and salt.
Add pecans if desired.
Pour into a large pie pan lined with unbaked pastry.
Bake slowly in a moderate oven until the custard mixture is set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEEF CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups leftover pot roast or 1 pound ground beef
- 1 large onion, coarsely cut
- 3 stalks celery, coarsely cut
- 1 green pepper, coarsely cut
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 can (101/2 oz) mushroom soup
- 1/2 cup water
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- Dash of black pepper
- 1 can (3 oz) chow mein noodles
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 325°F.
If using ground beef, cook until browned in 1 tablespoon butter; if using pot roast, chop into small cubes and cook for several minutes in 1 tablespoon butter.
Transfer beef to a medium-sized casserole dish.
In the same pan, add remaining butter and cook chopped onion, celery, and green pepper until limp.
Stir in mushroom soup, water, salt, and pepper, then pour over beef in the casserole dish and mix well.
Cover and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove cover, sprinkle chow mein noodles on top, and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALMON DELIGHT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can salmon
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 egg
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. milk
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Shape into loaf or patties, place in greased baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DATE BALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 stick butter
- 1 egg, well beaten
- 1 cup chopped dates
- 2 cups Rice Krispies
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- Chopped nuts or coconut
<|steps|>
Cook sugar, butter, egg, and dates over low heat until thick.
Remove from heat, add Rice Krispies and vanilla.
Shape into balls, roll in chopped nuts or coconut.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICH PASTRY PIE CRUST**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/3 cup. shortening
- 2-3 Tbsp. cold water
<|steps|>
Mix flour and salt, cut in shortening.
Add water, mix until dough forms.
Roll out to fit pie pan.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED RIBS**
<|ingredients|>
- Spare ribs
- Butter, for greasing
- 1 cup vinegar
- 1 cup water
- 0.33 cup catsup
- 1 lb butter
- 1 tsp sugar
- 2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Cayenne pepper, optional
- 6 quail
- 2 tbsp butter
- 2 tbsp flour
- 6 strips bacon
- 0.5 cup hot water
- Chopped parsley, for serving
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Grease ribs with butter and warm in an oven or on the stove slowly.
Boil vinegar, water, catsup, butter, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and optional cayenne for 10 minutes.
Pour sauce over browned ribs.
Bake in a 350°F oven for about 1.25 hours, basting and turning frequently until done.
Optionally, cook over charcoal burners for a superior barbecue.
**QUAIL**
Pick, draw, and clean quail, then split down the back.
Rub each bird with butter, sprinkle with salt, pepper, and flour.
Wrap with bacon strips and place in a large skillet or roasting pan.
Cook under a broiler until well browned, turning frequently.
Add hot water, cover, and bake in a moderate oven until tender.
Serve on toast, sprinkled with chopped parsley.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL CUSTARD CUPS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 Tbsp. light brown sugar
- 2 eggs, slightly beaten
- 1 cup. Pet evaporated milk
- 2/3 cup. water
- 1/3 cup. sugar
- 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- Few grains of salt
<|steps|>
Press brown sugar lightly into each of 4 custard cups.
Mix eggs, milk, water, sugar, vanilla, and salt; pour carefully over brown sugar.
Set cups in a shallow pan with 1 inch of hot water.
Bake at 350°F for 50 minutes or until a knife inserted near the edge comes out clean.
Cool, loosen edges, and unmold.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MINCEMEAT CHIFFON PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 envelope (1 tablespoon) unflavored gelatin
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 (28 oz) jar mincemeat
- 3 egg whites
- 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 9-inch baked pie shell
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in water in a saucepan, then heat over low heat, stirring until dissolved.
Remove from heat and stir in mincemeat; chill until the mixture mounds slightly when dropped from a spoon.
Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until frothy, then gradually beat in sugar until stiff and glossy.
Fold mincemeat mixture into egg whites.
Pile into the baked pie shell and chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WHITE SWEET POTATO PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. cooked potatoes
- 1 tall can evaporated milk
- 4 eggs
- 1 tbsp. vanilla
- 2 sticks margarine
- 3 cup. sugar
- 3 tbsp. flour
- 1 tbsp. lemon
<|steps|>
Pour into unbaked pie shells.
Bake at 350 to 375 degrees until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWEET-DILL PICKLES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 gal. cucumbers
- Alum powder (1 Tbsp. per gal. of water)
- Dill sprigs
- 6 lb. sugar
- 2 pt. white sugar
- 1 box pickling spice
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. tarragon vinegar
<|steps|>
Wash cucumbers and soak in brine (strong enough to float an egg, non-iodized salt) for 8 days.
Soak in clear water for 24 hours.
Cut into strips and soak in alum water (1 Tbsp. alum per gal. water) for 48 hours.
Rinse cucumbers and jars.
Place cucumbers and dill sprigs in jars, cover with hot syrup made from sugar and pickling spice.
Add 1 1/2 Tbsp. tarragon vinegar the next morning.
Weigh down and let set for 7-10 days.
Pack in quart jars with a dill sprig, heat syrup, and seal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 (300) cans cut asparagus
- 1 (10 1/2 oz.) can cream of mushroom soup
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, diced
- 1 cup. grated cheese
- 1 cup. cracker crumbs
<|steps|>
Drain asparagus.
Alternate layers of asparagus, soup, eggs, cheese, and crumbs in a greased casserole.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RED SATIN PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 qt. apple juice
- 10 bottles 7-Up
- 2 pts. cranberry juice cocktail
<|steps|>
Fill two trays with 7-Up and freeze until firm.
Mix together apple juice and cranberry juice cocktail.
Just before serving, add the remaining 7-Up.
Pour into a punch bowl over frozen 7-Up.
Serves 35.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MOLASSES NUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- ¾ cup butter or margarine
- 1/2 cup brown sugar, packed
- ¾ cup molasses
- 3 eggs, well-beaten
- 21/2 cups sifted flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Cream butter and brown sugar, then blend in molasses.
Add eggs.
Sift flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda together; blend nuts into dry ingredients.
Add dry ingredients gradually to the molasses mixture.
Pour into a greased 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan.
For the frosting, melt a 6 oz package of chocolate pieces over hot water, cool, then blend with ½ cup dairy sour cream and 1 teaspoon vanilla; spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED LIMAS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups dried lima beans
- 1/4 lb. salt pork, cubed
- 1/4 lb. salt pork, sliced
- 1 small onion, sliced
- 帮助我们改进翻译
- 1 clove garlic, chopped
- 1/4 cup fat
- 1 1/2 tablespoons chili powder
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 1 10 1/2-oz. can condensed tomato soup
- 1/3 cup vinegar
- 1 1/2 tablespoons prepared mustard
- 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
<|steps|>
Soak lima beans, then drain.
Cook beans with cubed salt pork in water until tender.
Drain, reserving 1 1/2 cups liquid.
Brown onion and garlic in fat.
Add chili powder, salt, tomato soup, vinegar, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and reserved liquid; cook for 5 minutes.
Layer sauce and limas in a greased casserole, topping with sliced salt pork.
Bake covered at 400°F for 30 minutes. Serves 8.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN A LA KING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1 can (4 oz) mushrooms
- 1/4 cup green pepper, chopped
- 1 tablespoon minced onion
- 1/4 cup butter or margarine
- 2 cups thin cream
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- 2 beaten egg yolks
- 21/2 cups diced cooked chicken
- 2 tablespoons finely cut pimento
<|steps|>
Lightly brown mushrooms, green pepper, and onion in butter.
Add flour and blend, then add cream and seasonings.
Cook until thick, stirring constantly.
Stir some of the hot mixture into egg yolks, then add to remaining hot mixture and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add chicken and pimento.
Serve on pastry shells or toast cups.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. thick white sauce
- 1 cup. toasted slivered almonds
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1/8 tsp. red pepper
- 2 cup. grated cheese
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. black pepper
- 1 No. 2 can green asparagus, drained
<|steps|>
Combine white sauce, 1 c. grated cheese, almonds, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and peppers.
Place asparagus in a buttered baking dish and pour sauce over.
Top with remaining 1 c. grated cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes. Serves 8.
**Thick White Sauce:**
- 2 Tbsp. fat
- 4 Tbsp. flour
- 1 c. milk
- 1/8 tsp. salt
Melt fat, add flour, and combine thoroughly.
Add milk and salt, cook on low heat until thick.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COAHOMA STYLE EGGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can deviled ham
- 1 can mushrooms
- 1/2 cup butter
- 20 stuffed hard-boiled eggs
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1/2 cup grated cheese
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Mayonnaise, to taste
- Stuffed olives, to taste
- Mustard, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- Lea & Perrins Worcestershire sauce, to taste
- Tabasco sauce, to taste
- Chili powder, to taste
- Garlic, to taste
- 2 teaspoons flour
<|steps|>
Prepare stuffed eggs by mixing mayonnaise, chopped stuffed olives, mustard, and paprika to taste with the egg yolks.
In a double boiler, combine deviled ham, mushrooms, butter, tomato soup, grated cheese, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco, chili powder, and garlic.
Thicken the sauce with 2 teaspoons flour and cook until thickened.
Place two halves of stuffed eggs in a scallop shell.
Cover with the sauce and sprinkle liberally with grated cheese.
Heat in the oven for 5 minutes before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEVILED CHEESE FILLING FOR CREAM PUFFS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup grated American cheese
- 0.25 tsp prepared mustard
- 3 tbsp mayonnaise
- 0.5 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp grated onion
- 5-6 drops Tabasco sauce
- 0.25 tsp celery seeds
- 0.5 cup boiling water
- 0.25 cup butter or margarine
- 0.125 tsp salt
- 0.5 cup flour
- 2 eggs
<|steps|>
For filling, mix cheese, mustard, mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce, onion, Tabasco, and celery seeds.
For puffs, boil water, butter, and salt; add flour all at once and beat over low heat until mixture forms a ball.
Remove from heat, cool slightly, and add eggs one at a time, beating well.
Beat until mixture has a satin-like sheen.
Drop 0.5 tsp dough per puff onto a baking sheet.
Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes until brown and puffy.
Fill puffs with cheese mixture, for 30-35 bite-sized puffs.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BRUNSWICK STEW**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 3-lb chicken
- 1 tbsp salt
- Few peppercorns
- 1 carrot
- 2 celery ribs with leaves
- 1 onion
- 1.5 quarts water
- 1 can tomatoes
- 3 medium onions, sliced thin
- 6 medium potatoes, sliced thin
- 1.5 cups fresh lima beans or 1 pkg frozen
- 2 cups fresh white corn or 1 can cream style
- 1 tbsp soy sauce
- 1 tsp sugar
- 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Steam chicken, salt, peppercorns, carrot, celery, onion, and water until chicken is very tender.
Strain stock, shred chicken, and return to stock.
Add tomatoes, potatoes, onions, lima beans, and seasonings.
Cook until vegetables are tender.
Add corn and cook 10 minutes longer.
Serve on split cornbread for 8-10 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DATE NUT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 (61/2 oz) package pitted dates
- 2 tablespoons shortening
- 11/2 cups boiling water
- 1 egg, beaten
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 21/2 cups sifted flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 cup chopped nuts
- 1/2 teaspoon lemon extract
<|steps|>
Cut dates into quarters, add shortening, and pour boiling water over; cool.
Add egg and sugar to the date mixture and mix.
Sift flour, salt, and baking soda together; combine with nuts and lemon extract.
Add dry ingredients to the date mixture.
Pour into a greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PERSIMMON PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 qt. well-ripened wild persimmons (raw)
- 2 cup. sour milk
- 1 cup. sweet milk
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1 cup. white sugar
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 3 1/2 cup. sifted flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 lb. butter, melted
<|steps|>
Wash persimmons and run through a colander or sieve, adding milk to ease the process.
Add eggs, brown sugar, white sugar, vanilla, flour, salt, soda, and melted butter.
Bake in a greased, floured 13x9x2 inch pan at 300-325°F for about 1 hour or until risen and settled.
Serve with whipped cream. Pulp or pudding can be frozen.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MINCEMEAT CHIFFON PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 envelope (1 tablespoon) unflavored gelatin
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 jar (28 oz.) mincemeat
- 3 egg whites
- 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar
- 1 cup sugar
- 9 inch baked pie shell, cooled
<|steps|>
Prepare 9 inch baked pie shell and cool.
Soften gelatin in water in saucepan.
Place over low heat, stirring constantly, until gelatin is dissolved.
Remove from heat.
Stir in mincemeat.
Chill until mixture mounds slightly when dropped from spoon.
Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until frothy.
Gradually beat in sugar, a little at a time.
Continue beating until stiff and glossy.
Carefully fold mincemeat into egg white mixture.
Pile into cooked pie shell.
Chill at least 1 hour before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS WITH CHESTNUTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can (12 oz) white asparagus
- 1 can regular celery soup
- 1 can water chestnuts, sliced
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Oleo or butter
- Cracker crumb topping
<|steps|>
In a buttered 1-quart casserole, layer white asparagus, celery soup, and sliced water chestnuts alternately.
Sprinkle cracker crumbs on top and dot with oleo or butter.
Bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes until bubbling hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE MOLD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1/2 cup flour
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup grated Old English cheese
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 4 eggs
- Creamed asparagus, for garnish
- Mushrooms, for garnish
- Tiny peas, for garnish
- Onions, for garnish
<|steps|>
Melt butter in a saucepan over boiling water and gradually add flour.
Add milk and cook until the mixture thickens, stirring constantly.
Add grated cheese and salt, stirring until melted, then remove from heat.
Gradually stir in well-beaten eggs.
Pour into a greased flat-bottomed pan and bake in a slow oven until golden brown and firm.
Unmold onto a platter, cover with creamed asparagus and mushrooms, and border with tiny peas and onions.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAPPY DAY CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/2 cup. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 3 egg whites
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tbsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Sift flour once, measure, sift flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a mixing bowl.
Cut in shortening.
Add milk and beat at high speed for 2 minutes.
Add egg whites and vanilla and beat 1 more minute at medium speed.
Pour into 2 greased 8" cake pans and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until done.
Stack with favorite filling. Delicious with 7-minute frosting and coconut.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL LAYER CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. cake flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs, separated
- 2/3 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 coconut, grated
- 2 lemons, grated rind and juice
- 2 cup. sugar (for filling)
- 1 cup. hot water
- 1/2 cup. pecans
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch or flour
<|steps|>
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together.
Cream butter and sugar, add egg yolks, then flour mixture alternately with milk and vanilla.
Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into batter.
Divide batter, add nuts to one part, and bake both parts at 350-375°F for 30-40 minutes.
For filling, combine lemons, sugar, and water; bring to a boil.
Add cornstarch or flour and cook until thick, then add coconut and nuts.
Spread filling between layers and on top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHERRY WINKS**
<|ingredients|>
- 21/2 cups sifted flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- ¾ cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 tablespoons milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 cup chopped dates
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1/3 cup drained and chopped maraschino cherries
- 21/2 cups crushed corn flakes
- Additional maraschino cherries, quartered, for topping
<|steps|>
Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together.
Blend butter, sugar, eggs, milk, and vanilla; beat well.
Mix wet ingredients into dry ingredients, then add dates, pecans, and chopped cherries.
Drop by rounded teaspoons into crushed corn flakes, toss lightly to coat, and form into balls.
Place on a baking sheet and top each with a quarter of a maraschino cherry.
Bake at 375°F for 12-15 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPICY PECANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 egg white
- 2 tablespoons water
- 1 6-oz. can pecans
- 2/3 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon ginger
- 1/4 cup cornstarch
<|steps|>
Beat egg white with water until slightly frothy.
Stir in pecans until well coated.
Combine sugar, cinnamon, ginger, and cornstarch; sift into a shallow pan.
Toss pecans in the sugar mixture to coat thoroughly.
Bake at 250°F for 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Cool and store. Yields about 3/4 pound.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROSTED FRUIT JUICE**
<|ingredients|>
- Mixture of desired fruit juices
- Grapefruit juice
- Lemon juice, for frosting
- Sugar, for frosting
- Cherries, for garnish
- Mint, for garnish
<|steps|>
Freeze the fruit juice mixture to a frappe stage.
Dip the rims of tall, thin glasses or ginger ale glasses in lemon juice, then in sugar, ensuring sugar doesn't run down the sides.
Fill glasses with the fruit juice frappe.
Pour grapefruit juice over the frappe.
Garnish with a cherry and mint.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SUGAR COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add egg and vanilla.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Roll out, cut into shapes, bake at 375°F for 8-10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEVIL'S FOOD CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 2 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup. cocoa
- 1/2 cup. hot water
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix cocoa with hot water, add to creamed mixture.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LOBSTER THERMIDOR**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tbsp melted butter
- 1 tsp finely chopped onion
- 1 medium green pepper, chopped
- 2 tbsp flour
- 2 cups sweet milk
- 1 can lobster meat or meat of 1 large or 2 small lobsters
- 2 hard-cooked eggs, chopped
- 3 slices bread
- 1 cup grated cheese
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Cook onion and green pepper in melted butter until soft.
Add flour and sweet milk, cooking until the cream sauce thickens.
Add lobster meat and chopped eggs.
Toast bread slices in a slow oven until crisp and dry.
Break one slice into small pieces and add to the lobster mixture in a baking dish.
Season with salt and pepper.
Roll remaining two toast slices into fine crumbs, mix with grated cheese, and sprinkle over the top.
Bake in a moderate oven until nicely browned.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **VEGETABLE SOUP**
<|ingredients|>
- Large soup bone or 2-3 lbs. soup meat and bone
- 1 Tbsp. salt
- 3 qts. water
- 1/3 cup diced carrots
- 1/2 cup chopped celery
- 1 1/2 cups diced potatoes
- 1 small onion
- 2 cups tomatoes
- 5 Tbsp. butter
- Additional 2 cups water if needed
- Salt and pepper to taste
<|steps|>
Place soup bone or meat in a large kettle, sprinkle with salt, add water.
Cook slowly for a long time.
Add carrots, celery, potatoes, onion, tomatoes, and butter.
Add more water if needed.
Season with salt and pepper.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOME MADE BISCUIT MIX**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 3 tablespoons baking powder
- 6 cups sifted flour
- 1 cup vegetable shortening
- 3/4 cup milk (per 2 1/2 cups mix)
<|steps|>
Sift salt, baking powder, and flour together.
Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse corn meal.
Store in a covered container. Yields enough for 60 biscuits.
To make biscuits, combine 2 1/2 cups mix with 3/4 cup milk.
Knead lightly, roll to 1/2-inch thickness, and cut into biscuits.
Bake at 425°F for 15 minutes. Yields 20 biscuits per batch.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN AND OYSTER GUMBO**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 Tbsp. flour
- 1/4 cup cooking oil
- 1 large onion, cut up
- 1 pod garlic, cut up
- 3 Tbsp. bacon drippings
- 1 Tbsp. green pepper, cut up
- 1 large fryer or hen
- Pinch of sugar
- Salt to taste
- 8 medium-sized pods okra
- 1 pt. raw oysters (with juice)
- Cooked rice
<|steps|>
Cook chicken in a large pot of salted water.
Sauté onion and green pepper in bacon drippings.
In a skillet, brown flour in cooking oil until very dark brown, being careful not to scorch.
Add browned flour, sautéed onion, and green pepper to simmering chicken.
Add sugar and garlic, cover, cook on low heat for 1 1/2 hours.
Add okra, cook until tender.
Add oysters, cook 15 minutes more.
Serve over cooked rice.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICE O'BRIEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup diced green pepper
- 1/4 cup butter or margarine
- 2 cups uncooked rice
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1 cup chopped pimiento
<|steps|>
Cook green pepper in butter until tender.
Add rice, chicken broth, and salt; heat to boiling and stir once.
Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 14 minutes or until liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and toss lightly with pimiento.
Serve hot.
Note: Rice keeps well in the refrigerator, reheats easily, and can be frozen.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **POTTED HAM ROLL**
<|ingredients|>
- Ground boiled ham or canned potted ham
- Commercial mayonnaise (if using ground ham)
- Pie crust dough
- Dash of Tabasco sauce
- 1 teaspoon celery seed
<|steps|>
Season ham to taste, blending ground ham with mayonnaise if needed.
Prepare pie crust dough with Tabasco and celery seed.
Divide dough into two parts and roll out each into a thin, long oblong shape.
Spread with ham filling and roll up like a cinnamon roll.
Bake until golden.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY LUSCIOUS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 packages strawberry gelatin
- 2 cups boiling water
- 1 large package frozen strawberries
- 1 No. 2 can crushed pineapple
- 2 ripe bananas
- 1/2 carton dairy sour cream
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.
Add thawed strawberries with juice, undrained pineapple, and mashed, whipped bananas.
Pour half the mixture into an 8 x 12-inch pan and chill until set.
Spread sour cream over the congealed layer.
Cover with the remaining gelatin mixture and chill until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PETTICOAT TAILS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup soft butter
- 1 cup sifted confectioner's sugar
- 1 teaspoon flavoring (vanilla, almond, wintergreen or rose)
- 21/2 cups sifted plain flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
<|steps|>
Mix thoroughly with hands.
Press and mold into a long roll about 2 inches in diameter.
Wrap in wax paper, and chill until stiff (several hours or overnight).
With thin, sharp knife, cut slices ⅛ to 1/16 inches thick.
Place slices a little apart on ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 400° for 8 to 10 minutes until lightly browned.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN LIVERS ON TOAST POINTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pounds chicken livers
- 1¾ cups flour
- 1/8 teaspoon black pepper
- 8 slices salt pork or country bacon
- 2 medium onions, finely chopped
- 1/2 pound thin-sliced mushrooms
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 5 cups chicken broth
- 2 or 3 drops Kitchen Bouquet (optional)
- Pinch of nutmeg
- 11/2 cups sherry
- 1 cup sour cream
- Toast points
- Paprika, for garnish
<|steps|>
Cut chicken livers in half and toss in 1 cup flour mixed with 1/8 teaspoon pepper.
Sauté salt pork or bacon until very crisp, remove, drain on paper towels, and keep warm.
Sauté livers in the drippings until cooked, then remove and drain on paper towels.
Sauté onions in the same pan until almost tender, add mushrooms, and cook until tender; remove and add to livers.
Add 2 tablespoons butter to the drippings, stir in ¾ cup flour, and cook, stirring constantly, until flour begins to brown (avoid burning).
Add chicken broth and stir until smooth and thickened.
If the sauce looks pale, add Kitchen Bouquet for color.
Season with nutmeg, salt, and pepper to taste.
Return livers, onions, and mushrooms to the sauce and heat through.
Stir in sour cream and sherry.
Serve on toast points, sprinkle with crumbled pork or bacon, and dust with paprika.
Note: Can be prepared ahead, reheated at serving time (add cream and sherry then), or frozen.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED APPLE RINGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 large red apples
- Brown sugar, as needed
- 4 tablespoons butter
<|steps|>
Cut each apple into 3 or 4 slices.
Fry slices in a skillet with 4 tablespoons butter for about 10 minutes.
Turn slices, sprinkle with brown sugar, and cover.
Cook until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREOLE KISSES**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg whites
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 lb nuts (black walnuts preferred)
- 1 tsp vanilla
<|steps|>
Beat egg whites, gradually adding sugar until the mixture holds its shape.
Add nuts and vanilla.
Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased brown paper.
Bake in a medium oven until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ANGEL PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg whites beaten stiff
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
- ¾ cups graham cracker crumbs
- 1 cup pecans (chopped)
- Whipped cream
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients except whipped cream.
Place in greased pie dish.
Bake 25 minutes at 350°.
Let cool.
Cover with whipped cream.
Let stand awhile before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT CHOCOLATE MIX**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. instant cocoa mix
- 1/2 cup. powdered sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. powdered cream
- 4 cup. powdered skim milk
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients and store in closed containers.
To use, stir 5 Tbsp. mix into a cup of hot water.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FUDGE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 eggs
- 4 tbsp cocoa
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup melted butter
- 0.5 cup flour
- 0.25 cup pecans
- 0.25 cup boiling water
- 1 tsp vanilla
<|steps|>
Melt cocoa and butter, then add sugar.
Beat eggs and add to mixture.
Mix flour and pecans, then add boiling water and vanilla.
Pour into a greased pie pan.
Bake at 325°F for 30 minutes until firm.
Serve with ice cream or whipped cream, for 6-8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALAD DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 small garlic clove, crushed
- 0.75 cup mayonnaise
- Juice of 1-2 lemons
- 0.25 cup ketchup
- Paprika, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 No. 2 can sauerkraut
- 2 medium apples, sliced, unpeeled
- 2 tbsp brown sugar
<|steps|>
Mix garlic, mayonnaise, lemon juice, ketchup, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Optionally add blue or Roquefort cheese.
Prepare the day before for best flavor, for 6-8 servings.
**RELISH**
Add apples and brown sugar to sauerkraut.
Simmer until apples disintegrate, for 6-8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE BOX DESSERT (OR SALAD)**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 eggs
- 1 cup sugar
- Juice of 2 lemons
- 1 tablespoon (1 pkg) gelatin
- 1/4 cup cold water
- 1 box Dream Whip
- 1 No. 3 can sliced pineapple, chopped
- 1 can Morgan dark sweet cherries
- 1/2 cup miniature marshmallows
- 1/2 cup pecans, chopped
<|steps|>
Beat eggs until thick, add sugar and lemon juice, and cook until thick (like pie filling).
Dissolve gelatin in cold water, then stir into the egg mixture; set aside to cool.
Prepare Dream Whip according to package instructions.
Chop pineapple, cherries, and pecans.
Fold fruit, nuts, marshmallows, and Dream Whip into the cooled egg mixture.
Pour into a large pan and chill for at least 24 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEVIL'S FOOD CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 sq. chocolate
- 1 cup. boiling water
- 2 cup. sugar
- 2 cup. sifted cake flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 eggs
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Stir chocolate in boiling water until melted.
Add sugar, flour, baking powder, and soda; stir with a spoon.
Add shortening and beat with a mixer on medium speed for 1 minute.
Add milk, vanilla, and eggs; beat for 1 minute more.
Bake in a 9x13 inch pan for 35-40 minutes or in two 9-inch pans for less time.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb flour
- 1 lb butter
- 1.5 lbs sugar
- 10 eggs
- 1.5 lbs seeded raisins
- 1 lb shelled pecans
- 0.25 lb citron
- 1 grated nutmeg
- 0.5 pint whiskey, wine, or brandy
<|steps|>
Dredge raisins, pecans, and citron with part of the flour.
Melt butter, add sugar, then eggs one at a time.
Add remaining flour, then floured fruit and nuts, nutmeg, and whiskey.
Steam for 3 hours, then bake in a moderate oven for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1/8 cup. shortening
- 2 cup. flour (more or less as needed)
- 1/2 or 3 lb. chicken
- 4 Tbsp. butter
- 2 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1 qt. water (for boiling)
<|steps|>
Mix together buttermilk, soda, salt, and shortening.
Add enough flour to make a stiff dough. Work it until quite firm.
Roll out about 2/3 of dough very thin. Cut into small pieces for dumplings.
Cut the chicken in pieces and boil in about 1 qt. of water until tender. Salt to suit taste.
Place the chicken and broth in 10 inch pan or casserole.
Drop in dumplings. Sprinkle in pepper and dot with butter.
Roll out remainder of dough large as pan and place on top.
Bake until brown, brush with butter and serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL ICING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups brown sugar
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1/2 cup cream
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1 cup confectioners' sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla or 1 tablespoon brandy
- Nutmeg, to taste
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 cup boiling water
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- Grated rind of 1 lemon
- Pinch of salt
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1 cup confectioners' sugar
- 1 egg, separated
- 2 tablespoons sherry or brandy
- 1/4 cup heavy cream, whipped
- 2 cups milk
- 3 egg yolks
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- Pinch of salt
<|steps|>
Combine brown sugar, butter, and cream in a saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches the soft ball stage (235°F).
Remove from heat, add vanilla, and beat until thick.
Spread over cake while still warm.
**HARD SAUCE**
Cream butter and confectioners' sugar until light and fluffy.
Add vanilla or brandy and a pinch of nutmeg.
Chill until firm and serve with pudding or pie.
**LEMON SAUCE**
Mix sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a saucepan.
Gradually stir in boiling water and cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in butter, lemon juice, and lemon rind.
Serve warm over puddings or cakes.
**FOAMY SAUCE**
Cream butter and confectioners' sugar until light.
Add egg yolk and sherry or brandy, beating well.
Beat egg white until stiff and fold into the mixture.
Fold in whipped cream just before serving.
Serve warm over desserts.
**CUSTARD SAUCE**
Scald milk in a double boiler.
Beat egg yolks with sugar and salt, then gradually stir in hot milk.
Return to the double boiler and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Remove from heat, add vanilla, and cool.
Serve chilled over desserts.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN MUFFINS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 1 heaping tsp baking powder
- 1 egg
- 0.75 cup buttermilk, approximate
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients together.
Add egg and enough buttermilk to make a thick batter.
Beat well and pour into very hot, well-greased muffin molds.
Bake in a 475°F oven for about 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HUNGRY BOY CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- **Casserole:**
- 1 pound ground meat
- 1 cup diced celery
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1/2 cup green peppers
- 1 clove minced garlic
- 11/4 cups water
- ¾ cup tomato paste (6 oz can)
- ¾ teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon Accent
- 1 pound can pork and beans
- 1 can lima beans, drained
- **Biscuits:**
- 11/2 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup shortening
- 1 egg
- Milk (enough to make 1/2 cup with egg)
- 1 tablespoon salad oil
- 1/2 cup sliced stuffed olives
- 1/2 cup slivered almonds
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1 cup reserved meat mixture
<|steps|>
**Casserole:** Sauté ground meat, celery, onion, green peppers, and garlic in a large skillet; drain.
Add water, tomato paste, salt, paprika, and Accent; simmer for 5 minutes.
Reserve 1 cup of meat mixture for biscuits.
Add pork and beans and lima beans to the remaining meat mixture, then transfer to an 8 x 13-inch or 2-quart baking dish.
**Biscuits:** Sift flour, baking powder, and salt; cut in shortening.
Combine egg with enough milk to make ½ cup, add to flour mixture, and stir until dough clings together.
Knead dough lightly about 12 times, then roll into a triangle.
Brush with salad oil, combine reserved meat, olives, almonds, and paprika, and spread on dough.
Roll dough as for a jelly roll, slice into 1-inch biscuits, and place on top of casserole.
Dot biscuits with butter and sprinkle with paprika.
Bake at 425°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CANDIED SWEET POTATOES**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 small sweet potatoes
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup water
- ¾ cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup margarine, melted
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 cup sugar
<|steps|>
Wash, peel, and parboil sweet potatoes in salted water for about 15 minutes.
Place potatoes in a greased baking dish.
Combine brown sugar, margarine, ½ cup water, cinnamon, and sugar to make a syrup; pour over potatoes.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes, basting occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WHITE POTATO PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. hot mashed potatoes (white sweet potatoes)
- 2/3 cup. evaporated milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 stick oleo
- 5 eggs
<|steps|>
Add sugar and oleo to hot potatoes and let melt.
Add milk, then eggs, one at a time.
Add vanilla and blend well.
Pour into an unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour or until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. E. L. MOTHERSHED'S NUT & DATE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 pound butter
- 2 cups sugar
- 4 eggs, separated
- 3 cups flour
- 1 package dates
- 1 quart pecans
- 1 teaspoon cloves
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon allspice
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 cup water
- 1 package figs or 1/2 pound cherries
<|steps|>
Sift flour, cloves, cinnamon, allspice, and baking powder together.
Cream sugar and butter, then add egg yolks and beat slowly.
Add water, then mix in dates, pecans, figs or cherries, and the dry ingredients.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into a loaf pan and bake at 300-350°F until done.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EASY COCONUT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 5 eggs
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1 stick oleo
- 1 can coconut
- 3/4 cup. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 unbaked 9-inch pie shells
<|steps|>
Mix eggs, sugar, oleo, coconut, buttermilk, and vanilla; beat well.
Pour into two unbaked pie shells.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes. Makes two 9-inch pies.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAMBURGER CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 onion
- 1 green pepper
- 1 lb. ground meat
- 1 medium size can cream style corn
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1 small pkg. noodles
- 1 stick butter
- 2 tsp. sugar
- Salt to taste
- Grated cheese
<|steps|>
Chop onion and pepper, sauté in butter.
Add meat, cook until pink.
Add tomato soup, corn, and cooked noodles.
Add sugar and salt, simmer for 30 minutes.
Let set until ready to serve.
Sprinkle with grated cheese, bake until warm and cheese melts.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APPLESAUCE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. applesauce
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. raisins
- 1/2 cup. nuts
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add egg and applesauce.
Mix flour, baking soda, spices, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Stir in raisins and nuts.
Pour into greased loaf pan, bake at 350°F for 60-70 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>
